title: Just when you think you weren't toxic...
body:
Holy cannelloni. I thought I wasn't toxic, then I went over my chat logs and re read them and holy.. I was cringing all the way through reading it. That was pretty toxic. Yep, that 2 week ban was well deserved. Damn, that moment of realization you have when you are reading what you did in a calmer manner, not when you're angry/frustrated. Damn, I need to change ASAP. I don't know who this person is.

-----------------------

Game 1
The Unbangable: thanks, we'll need it

The Unbangable: i cant
The Unbangable: its over
The Unbangable: you know at the beginning of the match, zyra was all up in teemo's booty in support.
The Unbangable: i warned about this, they called me toxic
The Unbangable: lol

-----------------

Gonna post this here out of shame. It's okay, I am slowly changing by being more active on this forum and reading a lot of positive helpful tips of being a better player.

replies.body:
Since this is your 14-day ban, next up would be a permaban. You'll need to go to the extreme once your ban is up to make sure you're on your best behavior. My best suggestion would be to not, under any circumstance, use chat. If you have a hard time resisting, you can bind the chat to something far less convenient than the Enter key. I'd also suggest either moving the chat window almost completely off the screen so you can't see it, or else get in the habit of muting everybody in the game from the start. Do all your communication in game with pings.

You basically need to keep it up for 3 months without a punishment, at which point you'll drop down one punishment tier (so if you got a punishment after 4 months, you'd be back at a 14-day ban). It'll take 9 full months with no punishments to get your account back to normal standing.

Good luck!

As far as I'm aware there isn't a way to rebind the chat to a key other than enter. Ever since Riot made it so the config files are saved server side and updated every time you log in there's been no way to change that. If there is a way, how?

I don't know what the exact lines are, but if you can't do it in game, there is a client-side file that does contain your input settings. In there, you can do more in-depth changes than what is allowed with the in-game settings. There should be something you can add to that file to bind chat to something other than Enter.

It's called input.ini, and it's controlled by a file called persistedSettings.json. I was looking into it for someone a few months ago and I found out that it's actually not editable anymore. Or rather any changes you make are erased whenever you log in because Riot keeps their own copy on the server which can only be edited through the in-game menu. I think it was because people were binding actions through that to scripts.

So sadly that's not an option anymore even though it used to work great.
My roommate uses a few custom keybinds that can't be changed in game, and I'm pretty sure he still has them working. I'll have to see what he's done for it.

Yeah, originally made a few changes myself back when things were working. My guess is the changes got transferred to the server with the move and stayed there. I looked into rebinding enter to some other key for someone on the boards about 2 months ago and found that any changes I made were getting reset when I logged in. When I looked it up I found a number of recent complaints of people no longer being able to make changes and a Rioter stating that players weren't supposed to mess with game files anyways...
I think there's some things they hold server side now, but not others. When that change happened, my roommate's settings were lost, but he went back and modified them again and they've stayed set.
Huh, I'll have to try again then :) thanks
Not possible? it's completely possible became extremely popular when people started to change mouse button 1 to attack move so you would never have to right click.

Just checked and confirmed. It's still possible to do these. Again,  not sure what the entries required for rebinding the chat key would be, but in Riot Games > League of Legends > Config, there's game.cfg and input.ini that can be modified to make these changes.
Eh this isn't the worst i've seen.

Ya way to see the light man. It's hard not to defend yourself verbally, but when u think about how many kids play this game and how kids are, it's easier to remind yourself that they'd say the same shit to anyone and it's not personal, they're just d-bags (adults too ofc, but I like to imagine they are children cuz it's easier).

Something I've begun doing is just treating it like you're on the same team so u pretend u are friends. Had a shitty jinx adc and I was brand support and at one point the jungler said something like come on brand help me (I was oom) and jinx goes "brand is a potato". I wanted to tear this 0/4 tower diving pos jinx a new asshole but instead I just said "what jinx? You're turning on me? I've been so nice" ...it was kinda hard to do but I treat it like a joke. Like aww now I'm sad u don't wanna be friends. Anyways, the jinx ended like 4/11/7 and I was 10/7/17, so I was glad I just let the play speak for itself and was proud that I didn't snap on jinx. He apologized for the potato comment at the end and told me good job. Negative experience turned positive by just staying positive regardless how douchey the person is being. Kill em with kindness, it's hilarious.
~inspirational~
I'm not toxic, it's just that when I switch my eye patch from left eye to the right my toxic split personality comes out.
Good job on the self-realization!  I think more players would be more responsive to find out how toxic they were if they could actually see their chat logs before the bigger punishment comes .
Appreciate all the comments and positive feedback/tips. Thanks and will be sure to jot those notes down and have them on my second monitor for a reminder <3
glad you understand. some people posted things just as bad and wonder why they got ban at all. understand it now will help you save your account since next punishment is perma-ban.
enabler, just stop talking to them like 70 sentences ago {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}  MUTE button is a beautiful thing

I think that I was in the previous thread of yours. I'm glad you saw how this can be pretty damn annoying to someone playing. I hope you embrace it and change before you get permabanned!

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

~~When you said "bud" I stopped reading. Anyone who calls someone "bud" is too edgy for me.~~

On a positive note, glad that you're making reforms to yourself! Good luck :D

I'm glad you realized how mean you were to your teammates.

Maybe, if you keep on this path of reform, you will be one of those players that challenges the idea that "League is the most toxic game" instead of reinforcing it.
Those players are truly an honor to play with, and its my hope that you'll join them, and perhaps inspire others to do the same.

> [{quoted}](name=The Unbangable,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=LerHMbBT,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-02-04T22:32:19.870+0000)
>
Snip

Ya know... I got permaed once, then i took an arrow to the knee. 

Srsly tho, I looked back at the logs, and asked why the fuck i was typing so much... So i stopped typing, and im climbing 100x easier.
If that's deemed bannable then I need to lock myself up preemptively.
Atleast you weren't permanently suspended because of the automatic system bug.

I always tend to do something calming whilst playing league - frequently booze, though not too much. Music choice helps a lot. I'll listen to something that makes me feel heroic or I'll listen to calm ambient music. And mute liberally as soon as I start getting mad. Rule of thumb, if they are just being mean now, they're never gonna say anything constructive.

Foxdrop is my favorite youtuber to watch, even though I'm a support main. I'd highly recommend watching this one in particular.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jcJg6MkHGMM

More congrats on realizing this.

{{champion:51}}
In the end, we all go to the same place.

hey dude! i feel you. i used to be this way (and before that even WORSE), and I still get a little passive-aggressive sometimes. i know it's hard to not comment on something your teammate did wrong bc from your perspective it seemed like a really stupid decision. my tip for you is to go just ONE GAME without typing ANYTHING. this is going to be hard and you might need to mute everyone so you aren't triggered, but just go one game without saying ANYTHINGGG. you'll realize that, while your teammates do make some stupid mistakes, they also make some really good plays as well. the less you talk in game and the more you focus on your own mistakes/good plays, you'll start to realize all the good things your teammates do. in the end, you'll realize how little commenting on someone's mistakes accomplishes and it's better to focus on the positive things. even if you are really behind, there are many chances to come back. you might even be able to start saying positive things every game instead of just spewing the negative.
damn. well good job realizing that you needed to change. i hope you dont lose your account. Best of luck :D
I'm actually surprised you owned up to it I would have hid it and never shown anyone.

You talk too much in chat. Toxic as fuck. Making your teammates tilt hard. 
You'll never climb to high elo.

Don't bring your problems onto other players. If you see picks you do not enjoy, op.gg the player as soon as possible, if he very low % win rate, dodge and lose 3LP. Block the player afterwards.

My suggestion would be to watch some Foxdrop videos on how to become a better player (from a behavioral point). He makes some very good points in his videos and provides some tools on how you can improve yourself.

Good that you realized you were being toxic and I wish you the best on your path to self improvement my good sir/ma'am. :)

Glad you're looking to improve however you can :)

I think one thing to remember is don't bother telling someone you're going to report them or asking other people to report them with you. Reports are just flags for further checking of a game, one flag is enough to get the game looked into, having more and more doesn't actually affect the severity of Riot's action.

Aside from that I recommend just going with the "if you have nothing nice to say don't say anything at all". It's seriously just not worth it to put in criticism or snide comments because it doesn't actually get you anywhere or change the person you're talking to, except to maybe piss them off. Mute early and often and say what you want to say out loud instead of into chat. You can say it, agree with yourself, and move on uninhibited.

And as others have said, be extra careful because after you get a 14 day it's more or less your next toxic game == a permaban.

I've seen worse.


Much, much, much worse.

I just recently got a 10 day chat restriction and I will be perfectly honest and say that I am glad to have gotten it. Everyone always thinks "oh it'll never happen to me" but it did. I've learned so much from the experience and I've already seen improvement in my attitude. Dot get me wrong I wasn't that toxic of a player but I had one really bad day where nothing went right and I took it out on my teammates and all of my sample games came from that day. Like I said I'm already seeing the value of staying positive in the midst of frustration. For example I just played a game yesterday where I was being attacked by two of my teammates because I was currently 0/2. I could've chosen to argue back and play their game, but instead I simply muted them and proceeded to remain positive for the rest of the game typing things like "gj team" whenever we had a good fight. We ended.up winning the game too! This just goes to show how much of a difference your attitude makes! Just think of how differently that game could have gone if I had chosen to waste my time on a pointless argument that wouldn't be helping us win. I hope you can find the same satisfaction with your experience and good luck in your future games! :)

Glad you realize your toxicity. Usually if I'm on tilt and had a bad game, I'll go play something else that relaxes me, take a walk and stretch my legs, or get something to eat and watch YouTube. Helps me avoid saying something I might regret and refreshes my mind for the next game. That and rarely use chat. The most I do is say a harmless joke in the beginning and then nothing but pings until the gg at the end. Maybe these techniques might help you out when you get back.
"/mute all" is your friend

It all seem'd normal flame and usual toxic that at one point we all say, until..

> he Unbangable: this kha is like mentally ill or something, ignore him

*cringe* I'd say that's ban worthy, hahah. try to understand peeps will definitely report you for stuff like this and it will get you banned. 
try to also ignore ultra sensitive stuff like being "mentally ill"

This is "Toxic"? Seems like standard frustration out of having some very bad people in your games. Who would not get mad at that? Are you supposed to not call out people on their bad plays? 

Sensitivity level...OVER 9000.
like wtf this is not even toxic  yes you where bitching about getting trolled but bitching does not equal toxic

Hella toxic.

Justified 2-week ban.... you are lucky you were not permabanned.

In my opinion you were pretty unlucky unless you are like that every single game. I would say that one game over 3 there is a player as toxic as you were. Although I report these players every time, I almost never see the message indicating that a summoner I reported got punished (I see it maybe once every month).

I also think you just write too much. Although what you write is never exceedingly negative, the fact that you spam chat may help everybody to remember they will report you.
Dude you talk waaaay too much in game...The volume of how much you talked in those games is more than I have probably ever talked in all my games combined.

Dude, this is in a timespan of 20 - 45+ minutes. 

Good players, even the ones who aren't being toxic, communicate with their team.

{{champion:17}}  Satan always wins.

Speaking out against him is foolish.
Its a shame that Riot and this games community has  convinced that those chat logs should be considered "toxic". Thats not a good thing...
